page.title: 07Tourist Information Centre
page.content: After sixteen years of rapid develop- ment under the Government backed New Town Scheme, Peterborough in 1985 is a well established commercial and industrial centre for the region. To those leisure attractions which existed before 1969 many more have been added to serve the new population In 1973 the city council opened its Tourist Information Centre to deal with the few visitors who came, but by 1984 they were dealing with over 70,000 enquiries per year. Now in 1985 the city is getting geared up to attract its share of the booming national tourist business, a market which is expanding at a time when the industrial trend is going in the opposite direction. A Peterborough Tourism Council has been set up to help local authorities and tourism firms to attract still more visitors.
